intro: Urostigma hochstetteri, commonly known as the New Zealand star-flower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are evergreen, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, white waxy coating. Urostigma hochstetteri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
